article: On Wednesday, April 16 I came home after three hours of sandbagging, wondering how anyone could do that for so long.I was _ , sweaty, and sore from my legs up.People were all determined to save their _ And we did not have school that day. You couldn't switch a _ on TV without seeing the news of the _ .I was sad. Even though the river was a long way from our place, I still _ sorry for the people who had to _ their homes go under the fearful Red River.I went to bed that night with a terrible _ in my mind. The next morning my mum woke my sister and me up and told us to _ our things.The water was _ sort of far away, but she didn't want to take any _ My father brought us to Red River High School where we took a bus to the Air Force base. My dad stayed behind to work at the hospital _ there was a shortage of _ .The place we stayed in was called a hangar .It was _ and crowded.My sister found a friend so I didn't see much of her. As a result I was bored enough to sleep. The next day my dad came and we all piled in the car and _ to my grandparents' farm in South Dakota.We stayed with my grandparents and went to school in the small town of Leola.We _ there on May 29.I found out that the flood waters never even entered our home.We were all _ for our good luck. The town was damaged to the tiniest detail.Then we saw people cleaning and working hard.The cleaning continued and life went on , but we will always remember the terrible flood.
